attributes.action: withdraw his invitation to Colonel Muammar Gaddafi, the Dictator of Libya, to visit the UK in December to attend the proposed Oil Summit, until the following demands have been met to the satisfaction of external Human Rights organisations recognised by the International Community.   To benefit the Libyan People: All torture to stop immediately, political prisoners held without trial to be released immediately and political prisoners tried and sentenced by the infamous People's Courts to be reviewed by International Courts, the abolition of Law 71 that criminalises anyone who forms a social or political party which criticises the current regime, to allow independent press and media and unrestricted access to the internet, to allow Libyan citizens the right to assemble in peaceful protest.
